prompt: Analyze key research methodologies used in education and evaluate how high-quality research supports evidence-based teaching practices.

criteria.name: Understanding of Qualitative and Quantitative Research Methods
criteria.description: Demonstrates knowledge of key research designs, data collection, and analysis methods.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Thoroughly explains and distinguishes qualitative, quantitative, and mixed methods with relevant examples.
performance_descriptors.good: Describes main research types with some supporting details.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions research methods without full clarity.
performance_descriptors.poor: No discernible knowledge of research methods.

criteria.name: Evaluation of Research Quality and Ethics
criteria.description: Analyzes criteria such as validity, reliability, and ethical considerations in educational research.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully critiques research quality and ethical practice using examples.
performance_descriptors.good: Explains research quality aspects and ethics with basic examples.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Vague discussion of quality and ethics.
performance_descriptors.poor: No mention of research quality or ethics.

criteria.name: Use of Research Examples in Practice
criteria.description: Effectively integrates examples of educational research influencing teaching practices.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Critically integrates studies illustrating impact on instructional decisions.

criteria.name: Connection to Evidence-Based Teaching
criteria.description: Explores how research findings translate into instructional improvements.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly articulates the link between research evidence and pedagogical changes.

criteria.name: Academic Writing and Logical Flow
criteria.description: Experience in formal academic writing with coherent organization.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Exceptionally clear, organized, and rigorous academic style.

key_points: Explain qualitative, quantitative, and mixed-methods research in educational contexts with examples.
Analyze reliability, validity, and ethical considerations critical to research quality.
Integrate case studies or influential research impacting education practice.
Discuss practical application of research findings to improve teaching.
Use clear, academic language with logical progression.
llm_questions: What distinguishes qualitative and quantitative methods in education research?
What ethical issues arise in educational research?
How can teachers apply research findings to their practice?
How does practitioner inquiry contribute to evidence-based teaching?
What are key challenges in educational research implementation?
